IIT-Delhi Is Going To Play A Pivotal Role In Deploying 5G In India For All Of Us

IIT-Delhi Is Going To Play A Pivotal Role In Deploying 5G In India For All Of Us

As the world gears up to begin adopting the new 5G wireless, standard, IIT-Delhi is also attempting to bring the new technology to India.

They're partnering with Swedish telecom giant Ericsson in order to set up a 5G innovation lab in India.

Ericsson and the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT Delhi) are partnering on the '5G for India' program, where the two will be developing new use cases for 5G. Basically, the two are going to try and develop new applications for 5G to solve some of India's major problems in various fields.

"DoT has taken increased interest over the last few days that has helped us fast-track the activities of the centre of excellence," says Brejesh Lall, coordinator of the 5G Centre of Excellence at IIT Delhi.

The two parties are currently awaiting the renewal of their spectrum licence in order to continue 5G work. And their experiments will provide improvements in more than just broadband and wireless communication.

The lab expects to use 5G to revolutionise everything from smart vehicles and public transport, to the automation of critical services, to allowing doctors remote access to patients in need of surgery, and even sensors networks for various purposes.

With 5G, doctors could conduct and oversee surgeries in far-off places in real time, bringing proper healthcare services to the poorest of the poor. It could be used to automate ticketing and other systems for public transport.

Honestly, the possibilities are endless, and IIT-Delhi wants to be on top of things as we slowly develop the infrastructure to implement all of this.
